page.title: 07THE SURGERY
page.content: Barton has one{surgery}and this is where people go for treatment.There are eight doctors in the{practice,}6 are there all the time and 2 who are part-time.Our local{doctor}works from 8.30 a.m.-7.30 p.m.Doctors get one weekend off in three.One doctor sees 46 patients in an average day and the whole surgery gets 500{patients}a day. The doctors not only see patients in Barton but they travel to other local villages.This way they meet lots of patients who would not get to the surgery. Patients who need special treatment and cannot be treated at the surgery are sent to Hull Royal Infirmary or Scunthorpe General Hospital.Sometimes Hull's hospital holds clinics at the surgery so they can examine the same medical problems.The most common illnesses are coughs and colds.
